item.title: Recognizing and commending the members of the Navy and Marine Corps who served on the USS Abraham Lincoln and welcoming them home from their recent mission abroad.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

item.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services. (text of measure as introduced: CR S5613)

summary.text: Commends the members of the Navy and Marine Corps who serve on the USS Abraham Lincoln (a Nimitz-class nuclear-powered aircraft carrier based at Naval Station Everett in Washington) and welcomes them home from their recent mission abroad (a deployment of nearly ten months in support of Operations Iraqi Freedom, Enduring Freedom, and Southern Watch).

bill.title: A resolution recognizing and commending the members of the Navy and Marine Corps who served in the U.S.S. Abraham Lincoln and welcoming them home from their recent mission abroad.

item.title: A resolution recognizing and commending the members of the Navy and Marine Corps who served in the U.S.S. Abraham Lincoln and welcoming them home from their recent mission abroad.
A resolution recognizing and commending the members of the Navy and Marine Corps who served in the U.S.S. Abraham Lincoln and welcoming them home from their recent mission abroad.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Committee on Armed Services. (text of measure as introduced: CR S5613)

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
